ARABIC: خَتَمَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَعَلَىٰ سَمْعِهِمْ وَعَلَىٰٓ أَبْصَٰرِهِمْ غِشَٰوَةٌ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Allah has sealed up their hearts and hearing and over their eyes is a blindfold. They will have a terrible punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: God has sealed their hearts and ears, and veiled their eyes. For them is great deprivation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Allah has sealed up their hearts and ears and a covering has fallen over their eyes, and they have incurred the severest punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: God has sealed their hearts and hearing and their vision is veiled; a great punishment awaits them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Allah has sealed their hearts and their ears, and on their eyes is a covering; and for them is a terrible punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Allah has set a seal on their hearts and on their hearing, and on their eyes there is a covering. Theirs will be a great torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing and there is a covering over their eyes, and there is a great punishment for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: God has set a seal on their hearts and on their hearing, and on their eyes is a covering, and there awaits them a mighty chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Allah hath sealed their hearing and their hearts, and on their eyes there is a covering. Theirs will be an awful doom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: God has sealed their hearts and their ears, and over their eyes there is a covering. They will have a terrible punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Allah hath set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their sights is a covering; and unto them shall be a torment mighty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Allah has set a seal on their hearts and their hearing, and there is a blindfold on their sight, and there is a great punishment for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Allah hath set a seal on their hearts and on their hearing, and on their eyes is a veil; great is the penalty they (incur).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Allah has set a seal on their hearts and on their hearings, (i.e. they are closed from accepting Allah's Guidance), and on their eyes there is a covering. Theirs will be a great torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and ears; their sight is dimmed and for them is a great punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: God has set a seal on their hearts and on their hearing, and over their vision is a veil. They will have a severe torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their vision is a veil. And for them is a great punishment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [2:7] God has set a seal on their hearts, impressing on them and making certain that no good enters them; and on their hearing, [in which He has] deposited something so that they cannot profit from the truth they hear; and on their eyes is a covering, that is, a veil so that they do not see the truth; and for them there will be a mighty chastisement, that is, intense and everlasting.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Allah hath sealed their hearts), stamped their hearts, (and their hearing, and on their eyes there is a covering), on their eyes there is a shield (and theirs will be an awful doom) an awful torment in the Hereafter. This refers in particular to the Jews Ka'b Ibn al-Ashraf, Huyayy Ibn Akhtab and Judayy Ibn Akhtab. It is also said that it refers to the idolaters of Mecca 'Utbah [Ibn Rabi'ah], Shaybah [Ibn Rabi'ah] and al-Walid [Ibn al-Mughirah].
